block.p: One year before the 1996 presidential election, the Immigration and Naturalization Service launched a program to naturalize 1 million immigrants. The timing raised eyebrows. Now a Justice Department report has found that while the agency bungled the job, and as many as 180,000 immigrants became citizens without proper background checks, officials did not improperly meddle with the program to beef up voter rolls by election day.

One year before the 1996 presidential election, the Immigration and Naturalization Service launched a program to naturalize 1 million immigrants. The timing raised eyebrows. Now a Justice Department report has found that while the agency bungled the job, and as many as 180,000 immigrants became citizens without proper background checks, officials did not improperly meddle with the program to beef up voter rolls by election day.
